description.title: front axle components : precautions for the repair

descmetadata.siename: front axle components : precautions for the repair

description.title: Advice to be followed before any operation

descbody.para: If a lift must be used for an operation, observe the safety instructions vehicle : towing and liftingGIEMR-002447.

description.title: Instructions to be followed during the operation

descbody.para: Do not press on the brake pedal during work on the brake system.
If, during work on the brake system, any damage on any part is observed, it must be repaired before driving the vehicle again.
Brake fluid is highly corrosive. Ensure any brake fluid spilt on parts of the vehicle is cleaned off.
In case of incorrect handling, the brake fluid can cause serious injury and damage. Follow the manufacturer's instructions for brake fluid.

description.title: Advice to be followed before any operation

descbody.para: Protect any bodywork components that risk being damaged by brake fluid with a cover.

description.title: Instructions to be followed during the operation

descbody.para: Clean around the braking system using brake cleaner vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445.

noteR.para: Prepare for the flow of fluid, and protect the surrounding components.

descbody.para: Do not allow friction materials to come into contact with grease, oil or other lubricants and cleaning products which are mineral oil based.

noteR.para: In order to prevent irreversible damage to the front hub bearing:

ul.li: Do not loosen or tighten the driveshaft nut when the wheels are on the ground.
Do not place the vehicle with its wheels on the ground when the driveshaft has been loosened or removed.

noteR.para: To ensure that the wheel speed sensor works properly, do not mark the sensor target on the bearing.

descsection.para: When removing a hub, it is essential to replace the bearing with a new one.

noteR.para: Do not press the bearing's internal bush so as to avoid damaging the bearing (very high shrink-fitting force).

descsection.para: It is essential to check the condition of the hub surface, bearing and stub axle carrier before refitting the bearing.
Use surface cleaner vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445Â to clean:

ul.li: the inner and outer surfaces of the new bearing in contact with the stub axle carrier and the hub,
the stub axle carrier surfaces in contact with the new bearing,
the hub surfaces in contact with the new bearing.

descsection.para: Always check the surface condition of the hub carrier before refitting the "hub - bearing" assembly.
Clean the hub carrier surfaces that are in contact with the "hub - bearing" assembly using surface cleaner vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445.

descbody.para: Replace any component whose contact surfaces have deep scratches or cracks.
When replacing the spring, ensure that the positioning and orientation of the spring and the tool cups are correct.
When replacing a spring, always replace the spring on the opposite side.
If a shock absorber is replaced, the shock absorber on the opposite side must also be replaced.
Check that the spring compressor tool is operating correctly.
In the interests of safety, do not leave a spring compressed in the spring compressor tool.
During assembly and removing operations, the surface and the protection paint must not be damaged.
There must be no impacts during operations. Any handling hooks and tightening or positioning clamps should be equipped with rubber or plastic in order to avoid damage on the springs.
Check that the areas where the strut is in contact with the body are clean.
It is recommended to replace springs if:

ul.li: there are dents on the spring.

descbody.para: They are not usually symmetrical in shape and care should be taken to assemble them the right way round. This can be done using the position of the coloured markings.

noteR.para: To prevent the suspension spring from prematurely breaking, do not damage the anti-corrosion protection.

descbody.para: During assembly and removing operations, the surface and the protection paint must not be damaged.
There must be no impacts during operations. Any handling hooks, tightening or positioning clamps should be equipped with rubber or plastic parts so as to avoid damaging the anti roll bar.
It is recommended to replace the anti-roll bar if:

ul.li: the anti-roll bar has dents in it.

noteR.para: the most critical and sensitive zones are in the elbows.
To prevent any damage, do not use the lower arm as support for the lifting system.

descbody.para: Check the condition of all the gaiters before refitting. Always replace any damaged components with new ones.

noteR.para: Do not degrease the lower arm ball joint, the grease on the gaiter seals the ball joint/stub axle carrier.

descbody.para: suspension ball joint: when removing/refitting, never allow the suspension ball joint to come up against the weight of the stub axle carrier.

on conical suspension ball joints, do not grease the gaiter where it connects to the stub axle carrier. The grease on the grooves guarantees a correct seal with the stub axle carrier. Do not interpret the presence of this grease as a leak.
